name: Hip Implant Dislocation - Serious Injury
description: Total hip replacement implant dislocation requiring revision surgery. Serious injury requiring MDR.

fields.event_description: Patient presented to emergency department with severe left hip pain 8 months post total hip arthroplasty. Imaging confirmed posterior dislocation of the femoral head from the acetabular cup. Closed reduction was attempted but unsuccessful. Patient required revision surgery under general anesthesia to reposition and stabilize the implant. Examination of the device during surgery showed the acetabular liner had excessive wear and the locking mechanism appeared compromised.
fields.patient_outcome: Required revision surgery. Extended hospitalization (5 days). Currently in rehabilitation.

ground_truth.coding_rationale: A0702 (Dislodgement of Device or Component) for the hip dislocation. A0603 (Material Deterioration) for the excessive wear on the liner. C1302 (Surgical Intervention) and C12 (Hospitalization) for patient outcomes. Requires MDR due to serious injury requiring surgical intervention.
